turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh, baby, I'm so sor...

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: IT'S NOT YOUR <u>FAULT</u>!!

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: I <u>did</u> what she said.  I <u>used</u> my words, I <u>told</u> him what I <u>felt</u>, and they...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: ...laughed, yeh.  They laughed real hard.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Now is that little prick still here, because if he is, I'm gonna rip his fucking <u>heart</u> out!

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: No, <u>his</u> mother's always on time.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: And Mom says anger never, never <u>solves</u> anything.  It makes every- thing <u>worse</u>.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: That's because your mother is a fine person, finer than I will ever be.  Now, just this once...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And you<u>don't</u> tell her.  What you're going to say.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: Not use my words, please!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No, baby.  You're gonna use <u>my</u> words.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Help me here...

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: Uh.  He thinks his nose is too big.  But it's not.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Great.  Big ears, too?

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: No.  But they stand out, a little. Like this.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: Uh.  What is it?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh.  It's an incredibly disgusting, and not remotely sexy thing, that they described in a movie I'd never let you go to.  But it's real.  Does he have an older brother?

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: In high school.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: He'll be impressed.  The clincher is, you <u>walk</u> away, then <u>whip</u> around...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: The guy <u>I</u> see is in the eighth grade at <u>Prep</u> School, and he laughs his <u>ass</u> off every time we talk about you.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: But Rache...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: A <u>suitable</u> boy, will be at <u>this</u> flagpole, <u>on</u> Monday, with a <u>very</u> expensive bike, and he will be a stone FOX if I have to call an <u>escort</u> service!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Now Ladies, the secrets to a great pie is the crust.  And the secret to a great flaky pie crust comes from less flour and more...what?

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: Ice cold water.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: That's my girl...

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: I hate her.  I really hate her.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: There you are!

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: Don't take my picture!

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: No they're not.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Annabelle put down that camera.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Put down that <u>goddamn</u> camera!

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: You owe me a quarter.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You do NOT run out on your moth...

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: YOU'RE WORSE THAN <u>SHE</u> IS!  WHY DON'T YOU JUST DIE, <u>TOO</u>?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You know, this horse smells really bad.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: There's worse things.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: ...your hating me.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLE
turns.text: Cos she loves you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Cos she loves <u>you</u>.  She wanted you to have a daddy to love.  Even if he didn't...completely...deserve it.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh my God.  That is so not funny.  You're late.  You're really late.  Now get out here and have some cereal.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Fine!  Eat in the cupboard.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No!  Cocoa Puffs on Top -- Fruit Loops on the bottom.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You touched it.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Then have a donut --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Alright starve.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But you told us to starve.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hello?...Duncan...The Ad Agency's already there?...I'm out the door...  Ben!  Knock it off!  It's gonna go beautifully...  Damn it Ben --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: ...EGGzactly.  I'm putting on my coat --  We are late.  We are seriously late.  Which means Mister Ben we've got to get you dressed --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Excuse me --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Annabelle let's get something clear.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I made you some cocoa.  See?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Thank you Ben.  That was so sweet of you.  Goodnight Annabelle.  Sweet dreams.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: "In the great green room there was a telephone and a red balloon..."

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Aren't you going to drink your cocoa? It's the good kind.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Mmmm!  Tasty.  You're a master chef Ben. Just like your dad.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: "Goodnight moon, goodnight hush, goodnight mush, goodnight goodnight goodnight Gracie -- Goodnight Ben!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No!  You're cheating -- you have to start from the beginning and you have to read the whole thing I can't sleep otherwise.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: "In the great green room there was a telephone and a red balloon..."

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: "And a picture of the cow jumping over the moon..."

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: That's nice Ben.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Are you <u>real</u> mad?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: How could I be?  We learned some magic...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: ...for Christmas, okay?  Every magician needs a white dove, a <u>real</u> one, they <u>do</u>!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Well, that's a long way off, sweetie. We'll talk to Mom and Dad...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Dad!  You can talk him into anything!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: 'In the still...still of the ni-ight...I held you... held you so ti-ight'...take it, man...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Doo-wop-doo-doo, <u>doo</u>-wop-doo-doo...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: IS THAT YOU?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: IT'S YOUR GIRLFRIEND, BIG GUY, OPEN UP.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Why does Rachel wear Daddy's underpants? Doesn't she have underpants of her own?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I noticed a whopping pile of laundry sitting on the washer -- perhaps Rachel's underpants are in there -- Now where are your lunches?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I hate snails and blue cheese. Especially together.  <u>Hate</u>.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I have lava.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Lava's hateable.  I never thought of that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Queen of diamonds.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Seven of clubs.  Nobody's mad we just want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Poof!  You're happy now.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Thank you Ben.  Annabelle!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ben!  Oh my Ben!  Are you alright?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I knew where I was all the time.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mommy?  It's not Rachel's fault I ran away.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, that's your fault.  It's her fault for not watching over my precious son, as if it were her priority.  Which means, the most important job.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Rachel's job is she works.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ben, mommies work too.  They work very hard.  Mommy works harder as a mom than she did when she was working.  I just don't get paid.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Does Rachel make a lot of money?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: People like Rachel who only think about themselves often do make a lot of money.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think she's pretty, Mommy.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yes...if you like big hair...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mommy?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What honey?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: If you want me to hate her I will.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Rache says I have to eat <u>lamb</u>.  I told her <u>you're</u> making me <u>spaghetti</u>!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Honey, this is Thursday.  I pick you up tomorrow, and we do <u>big</u> spaghetti.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: And many meatballs.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You'll be up to your armpits in meatballs, I'm flying them in from Sweden.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Is that like Luigi's?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not a lot, sweetie.  It's a country. Like Canada.  Only smaller.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Where are you, anyway?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm somewhere, thinking of you.  And meatballs.  And you know what?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Of course, you do.  Being magic. Then you know I've got a flu bug, and I turn green and barf profusely when I even think about food.  So, all the more meatballs for you.  But you know what.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I did.  Do I have to eat lamb? Daddy didn't cook it, she did.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do me a favor?  Eat it, and then give me a secret report, okay?  Pay particular attention to whether it's chewy and if it tastes more like chocolate or soup.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That I do.  Always will.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mom...?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm fine, ba...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Tomorrow?  Can I have one butterscotch pudding for dessert?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Mommy, if your real name's Jackie and I call you mommy; and Rachel's real name's Rachel...Then when I see her do I say hi Stepmommy?  And if my name's Ben, how come you don't call me son?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Thursday's fine...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ARE YOU CRAZY, YOU COULD <u>SUFFOCATE</u> IN THERE!!!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Nope.  I got my warm t-shirt.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Pray.  We never find out.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Mommy's sick, guys.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You have the WORST flu since...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I have cancer.  Do you know what that is?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Grammy had a different kind. There are lots of kinds.  Hers was very bad.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Is your bad?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: So you're okay.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm still sick, but I'm better.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: In the still...still of the ni-ight...I held you...held you so ti-ight...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's Rache's song!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sugar.  I was slow dancing to that song before Rachel was even born.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ben!  Mommy's so glad to see you -- Now stop climbing!  Ben listen to me...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No!  I have to get there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Where Ben?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Before you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ben where do you have to get to?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Heaven.  I have to tell him he's made a mistake.  He should take Grammy Martha first.  Or Grandpa Norman.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ben.  God doesn't like visitors.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ask her, she's a heroic Fireperson. She does this twenty times a day.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Okay.  These are good.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I helped.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I've got a lot of medicine in me, sweetie.  And I'm a little wobbly for driving or running ar...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Rache can do that part.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Find the bird cage?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Rache says it's from you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, don't make him disappear before I see him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: So what do you think we're gonna talk about?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You dying.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If a soldier loses his legs in a war.  Is he the same guy?  Sure he is.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But you can still see him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Half.  Of him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The world.  <u>Thinks</u> I'm gone.  But only the magician.  Knows better.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: So where are you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Right here.  Right here.  <u>Inside</u> the magician.  Shhhh.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Can I talk to you?  When you're there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Always.  Always.  And you won't hear a voice.  But in <u>here</u>.  You'll know.  What I'm saying.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's not good enough.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, it isn't.  Because it isn't everything.  And we want every- thing, don't we?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Cooper, back the fill off I don't have enough shadow...

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: You've got a fruit loop in your hair.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You say that like I don't know that.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: I once threw an entire bowl of jello on my stepmother's head --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And when did that pass?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Actually, never.  They'll always hate you.  There's a gene for it.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: May I remind you that Duncan has the <u>client</u> arriving at exac...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Sure.  I was just doin' my nails.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: People beat it, don't they?  All the time.

turns.speaker: DR. SWEIKERT
turns.text: Every day.  More and more.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: So we'll...radiate some more?

turns.speaker: DR. SWEIKERT
turns.text: At first.  Then, after awhile, some chemo.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's necessary, huh?

turns.speaker: DR. SWEIKERT
turns.text: Let's take our best shot.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I have to get dressed.  My ex-husband has asked me to dinner.  God knows why, he was very mysteri...

turns.speaker: DR. SWEIKERT
turns.text: Have you still never told him?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Why would his worry?  Or my children's worry.  Or anyone's worry.  Help the sit...

turns.speaker: DR. SWEIKERT
turns.text: Sooner than later.  You really need to.

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: Congratulations.  Only forty minutes late.  You're handling this promotion really well Rachel.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Duncan.  My work is everything to me. This'll never happen again.  Now stand back -- this session's gonna make you remember why you hired me even though I wouldn't sleep with you -- Cooper let's get these penguins dancing --

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It's 1:45, I told you there's no one to pick up Annab...

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: But you're not <u>done</u>!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I've got it.  It's in the can, Cooper can wrap th...

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: We don't KNOW if you've got it, we haven't SEEN it yet!  Now go back and FINISH!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Which part of no don't you understand?

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: Look, I will <u>send</u> a P.A. to pick up the children.  There are <u>agencies</u> that supply sitters, nannies...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: They're losing one mother.  They can't lose two.

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: You're making a <u>career</u> decision here, I would <u>strongly</u> sugg...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Duncan.  I've got an <u>even</u> <u>better</u> idea...

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: You can't <u>do</u> that, I won't <u>let</u> you!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No, no, no, this is a job that's hard to <u>keep</u>, <u>not</u> a job that's hard to <u>lose</u>, can't be both.

turns.speaker: DUNCAN
turns.text: Rachel, <u>don't</u> do this, you will <u>never</u> forgive yourself!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Planning on getting --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Remarried.  There is no move.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Are you here?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Because you don't really seem here.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm here.  I've got a case where they're this close to sequestering the jury but have I answered the goddamn thing?!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Something's up wi...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You think I didn't get that?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I've been with someone for quite some time, and didn't feel it was appropriate for her to move in too quickly.  But after a lot of thought and careful discussion with her -- and the kids I might add -- she moved in last month.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Since our divorce Luke has seen a number of different women in three short years and without a lot of warning for the kids, he's now living with a woman half his age --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Rachel's not half my age.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We're not discussing your age.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, we're not discussing Rachel's age either.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They want to be with you Luke, they go to your house to be with their father.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Jackie, they come to be part of my life.  Rachel <u>is</u> part of that life.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Napalm.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Except for last Thursday when Rachel forgot to pick them up --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Jackie, she was five minutes late --

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Thank you Mrs. Franklin.  Jackie?  This has been very valuable for us.  And I'll have a serious talk with Annabelle tonight.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's Wednesday night.  She's at my house.  I'll talk to her.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'll call from work.  We can have a conference call.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You tried that last week and we were on hold forty-five minutes...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You ask me that counselor's making a mountain out of a molehill...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm worried.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Luke, I need to switch next Friday for Thursday, so why don't you take the weekend...  ...that way you'll be there, and I'll pick up Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Fine.  But I wanted to take the kids to work with me on Wednesday so I'll take Wednesday, and you can pick up that Thursday, Friday after soccer, and Saturday before riding.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Easy enough.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Good...Well...Take care.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Just outside the big top, we're almo...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're WHERE?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: At the Big Apple Circus, it's the only big top I know.  I <u>said</u> I'd get 'em back tonight...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Jackie, <u>we</u> were taking them water- skiing for the <u>whole</u> weekend!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...until the plan changed, when Jessie's mom gave us these tickets. What, Rachel. 'forgot' I told her?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Our children.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do you realize what could have hap- pened to your son today?  How lucky we are the police found him before some lunatic did?  He could have been...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But he hasn't.  He wandered off.  I know it's terrifying.  I can imagine how you felt when that call came -- But it happens.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not to me.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Jackie, you've made mistakes -- We all make mistakes --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm not gonna wait around to see the next one.  I'm not gonna watch my kids fall through the cracks of this arrangement.  I'm seeing a lawyer.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Jackie stop.  We promised we never go there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We've broken a lot of promises, haven't we Luke?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Called him.  We set an ap...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Don't do this.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're saying, don't make the kids a football, don't put them through a war.  But I'm doing this for <u>their</u> well-being.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Partly.  But partly, you're mad.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You know the kids aren't really in danger.  This is about Rachel, and you're right, I'm disappointed in her learning curve, and...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: <u>Slugs</u>.  Have faster learning curves. <u>Trees</u>, even.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm afraid she's going to walk.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And I'm supposed to care.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Still, please.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Annabelle showed me the new dress. She's amazing in it.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Getting so beautiful...she looks more like you every day.  Jackie...I've really given this a lot of thought.  A great deal of thought...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I didn't think a phone call was appropriate...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Tell me exactly how you're different from three years ago?  The music sounds kind of the same from where I'm sitting.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I grew up, a little.  I'm ready for a life that's built around commitm...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Just not to me.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's going to be hard for the kids when I tell them...I'd like you to be there.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: To make it easier for them or you?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's a huge moment in their life --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You can't be an 'us' just when you want to.  You can't play that card when it's convenient.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: WE are over.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: WE'RE still their parents for the next hundred years.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're still going to have to be dealing with me -- with us.  We should tell them together.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No.  You think this is going to help the kids then you do it.  You're on your own.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The great thing about life is that things keep changing.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Remember when Mommy and Daddy got divorced?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And we all went through that together?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: She's a charmer, you'll see.  In fifty years, the kids'll love her ten percent as much as they love you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Stop.  You're making me insecure.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's temporary.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's good.  You're not pulling a mid-life crisis on us, are you?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You want us to take him tonight? Give you some private time with Annab....

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Never stand between that kid and a meatball.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yet another spaghetti night.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeh, better I should forcefeed him burnt lamb and...couscous, was it she made him?  Boy, kids go wild for that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know.  I wouldn't know what to say.  If it were you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We're going to win this.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Walk in the park.  And thanks for the 'we'.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What happens next?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I live or I die.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I had a lot of treatments, and they weren't any fun, but the tests show the cancer got smaller.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: A lot smaller.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How do you hold down a job?  It's 8:10. You were supposed to be here at 7:00. She's missed her sunrise Groom'n Ride.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: This is Friday, her riding lesson is on Tuesdays.  I got it right here...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Every Tuesday except the 3rd Tuesday of the month when it's switched to Friday except in April when she rides on Thursday.  It's not that hard.  Didn't you have a mother?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Can I please have a cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We don't have any coffee.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What is this?  The Betty Ford Center?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Annabelle, how's your video rep...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What happened with Annabelle?  Has nothing I said gotten through to you?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Maybe you could back off just a little bit --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What did you do?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Nothing.  Look, I want to talk to you about...well...Luke said to ask you...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: She's been talking about this little editing machine, it's only...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: ...a ridiculously <u>expensive</u> and <u>inappropriate</u> item, which her father and I have already <u>told</u> her she is <u>far</u> too young to own.  But <u>you</u> apparently want to <u>buy</u> her forgiveness, with...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: <u>Forgiveness?</u>  For <u>what</u>, exactly?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Luke was in the shower this morning and Annabelle sort of walked in without knocking.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm sure that didn't upset her. Everyone in our family takes showers.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I was in there in him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Did you or Luke talk to her about it afterwards?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No.  I thought it might be uncomfortable for her --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You mean for you.  A 10-year-old girl is coping with the fact that her father is never coming back to live with his family.  She sees her father naked with another woman for the first time. And you think it's best for her if every- one pretends it didn't happen?  This isn't going to work out.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You're damn right.  I'm gonna sick of your imperious bullshit.  I never said I was Betty Fucking Crocker.  If every time life hits her in the face you want to have a 12 hour talk every third Friday or the month -- go ahead!  I have a life!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh and I don't because I have a children?! The problem is you're too self-involved to ever be a mother.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Maybe the problem is your <u>kids</u>.  Maybe they're spoiled, coddled <u>brats</u>!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Get out!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: But it's not on the schedule!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You got to hell!
